Name: Cuba Libre
Ingredients: 60 ml Light gold rum (1-3 year old molasses column)
Instructions: Select and pre-chill a Collins glass .
MUDDLE lime wedges in base of glass.
Fill glass with ice and briefly stir.
Review: Basically, a rum and coke with a squeeze of lime, but Cuba Libre has much more of a ring about it. Zesty lime and dashes of bitters add layers of complexity, balancing the sweetness of the cola.
History: In his 1939 The Gentleman's Companion , Charles H. Baker Jr. calls for the lime to be muddled to extract the oils in the skin:
